shared_diagnostic_path.reasoning_pattern: Fatigable weakness → antibody testing + EMG → localize to NMJ

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose the patient presenting with cough, difficulty walking up stairs, and muscle strength changes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports a 3-month history of cough and progressively worsening difficulty walking up stairs. He mentions that it becomes easier to climb stairs after he has been active. He has also experienced a significant weight loss.

Secondary_Symptoms: Weight loss of 4.6 kg over the past 6 months

Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: The patient has been smoking one pack of cigarettes daily for 35 years.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Works in construction, lives in a two-story apartment without an elevator.

Review_of_Systems.Neurological: Muscle weakness, improvement in muscle strength with activity, slow pupil reaction

Neurological_Examination.Muscle_Strength: Proximal lower extremity strength initially 3/5, increasing to 5/5 after repeated muscle tapping
Neurological_Examination.Pupillary_Reflex: Pupils equal but react sluggishly to light

Electromyography.Findings: Decreased compound muscle action potentials that increase in amplitude with repetitive stimulation

Voltage_Gated_Calcium_Channel_Antibodies.Findings: Elevated levels, supportive of Lambert-Eaton syndrome diagnosis

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose the patient presenting with weakness and fatigue.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports feeling extremely fatigued and weak, especially towards the end of the day, to the point of difficulty in self-care. She mentions experiencing these symptoms currently. The patient has been traveling, hiking, and camping recently and notes having had multiple illnesses in the recent past.
Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: No significant past medical history provided.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Enjoys outdoor activities such as hiking and camping. No mention of smoking, alcohol, or drug use.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: Denies fever, weight loss, headache, or any respiratory, gastrointestinal, or urinary symptoms.

Acetylcholine_Receptor_Antibody.Interpretation: Indicates the presence of autoantibodies to acetylcholine receptors, which is associated with myasthenia gravis.

Electromyography_and_Nerve_Conduction_St.Finding: Decreased response with repetitive nerve stimulation, suggestive of a neuromuscular junction disorder.

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose the patient presenting with a chronic cough, difficulty walking up stairs which improves after exercise, and significant weight loss.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports a 3-month history of chronic cough and progressively worsening difficulty in walking up stairs in his apartment. Interestingly, he notes that his ability to climb stairs improves after he has exercised. Over the last 6 months, he has also experienced a weight loss of 4.6 kg (10.1 lb). The patient has been smoking one pack of cigarettes daily for 35 years.

Secondary_Symptoms: Weight loss of 4.6 kg over 6 months

Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: No significant previous medical or surgical history reported.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Smokes one pack of cigarettes daily for 35 years, occasional alcohol consumption.

Review_of_Systems.Musculoskeletal: Progressive muscle weakness, improving with exertion

Neurological_Examination.Muscle_Strength: Proximal lower extremity strength initially 3/5, improving to 5/5 upon repeated muscle tapping

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose the patient presenting with double vision, difficulty climbing stairs, and upper limb weakness.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports a 1-month history of experiencing double vision (diplopia), difficulty in climbing stairs, and weakness when trying to brush her hair. She notes that these symptoms tend to worsen after physical activity but improve significantly after a few hours of rest.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Non-smoker, drinks wine occasionally. Works as a graphic designer.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: Patient denies experiencing any chest pain, palpitations, shortness of breath, or recent infections.

Neurological_Examination.Cranial_Nerves: Presence of ptosis (drooping of the right upper eyelid) that worsens with sustained upward gaze.
Neurological_Examination.Motor_Strength: Diminished motor strength observed in the upper extremities, with normal tone and no obvious atrophy.

Electromyography.Findings: Decreased muscle response with repetitive stimulation

Chest_CT.Findings: Normal, no thymoma or other masses detected.
